newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY-NEW LIONS KEEP UP WINNING START.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY-NEW LIONS KEEP UP WINNING START.

text.p: Gauteng Lions secured a fourth successive Super 12 rugby union victory on Saturday when they beat New South Wales 36-27 in a thrilling battle.
The Lions, until a week ago known as Transvaal, had seen a 24-6 lead turn into a two point deficit 15 minutes into the second half.
Lions full-back Gavin Johnson hauled the hosts back into the lead with his fifth penalty to make it 29-27 with 18 minutes remaining.
It stayed that way until the 80th minute as both sides went close to scoring before Lions scrum half Johan Roux crowned a fine game by diving over from close range to make it 36-27.

Johnson converted to crown another fine evening for the number 15. He was successful with seven out of eight kicks at goal to add to his first-half try in a personal haul of 26 points and he has now scored 87 points in four Super 12 games.
The win kept Gauteng Lions on top of the standings but they had to weather a ferocious comeback from the Waratahs after they appeared to have run the Australians out of the match in the first half.
Full-back Matthew Burke had kept NSW in touch by kicking two penalties to Johnson's four to make it 12-6 after 28 minutes.

But converted tries from Lions skipper and lock Kobus Wiese -- driving on to Roux's pass -- and from Johnson -- after a break from his own half by Springbok centre Japie Mulder -- left the visitors reeling at 26-6.

They showed great character to respond before the interval with a try from winger Alistair Murdoch after a superb break by powerful centre Graeme Bond. Burke converted to it make it 26-13 at half time.
Further tries from number eight Fili Finau after a break by the impressive Matt Burke and from flanker Stuart Pinkerton after sustained pressure took NSW into the lead after 55 minutes.
At that point they looked capable of ending the Lions' unbeaten start to the season but they were unable to extend the lead.
Johnson kicked his side back into the lead with a 62nd minute penalty and it was the home side who finished the stronger before a crowd of 22,000.
The Lions' will expect to maintain their 100 per cent start with a home match against Wellington on Saturday.

Gauteng Lions - Gavin Johnson; Wickus Venter (Dawie du Toit 71st), Japie Mulder, Joe Gillingham, Jannie van der Walt; Hennie le Roux, Johan Roux; Andre Vos, Ian Macdonald, Piet Krause, Hannes Strydom, Kobus Wiese (captain), Kapstok van Greuning (Roerto Grau 68th), Chris Rossouw, Balie Swart.

New South Wales - Matthew Burke; Alistair Murdoch, Graeme Bond, Richard Tombs, Chris Latham; Nathan Spooner (Scott Bowen 46 mins), Sam Payne; Fili Finau, Stuart Pinkerton, Willie Ofahengaue (Daniel Manu 50 mins), Sam Domoni, Tim Gavin (Captain), Andre Blades, Mark Bell (Phil Kearns 42 mins), Richard Harry.
